alert.note: Alert for Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by heavy rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Otsego. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated rain due to thunderstorms continuing but weakening in intensity. Localized minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Cooperstown, Richfield Springs and Bowerstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
